name: From Anchor to Zephyr Online Trivia | Alphabetical Words | 25 Questions

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, means a writer?
questions.explanation:
author.

	Other words beginning with A and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include anchor, armor, or aquifer.

questions.text: Sweet, sour, salty, or _______ - which word, ending with the -ur sound, completes this familiar list?
questions.explanation:
bitter.

	Other words beginning with B and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include better, bettor, batter, butter, or Beamer.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is a kind of thick soup?
questions.explanation:
chowder.

	Other words beginning with C and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include catheter, chatter, cleanser, cancer, canter, or cantor.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, would describe someone who is neat and trim, or nicely dressed?
questions.explanation:
dapper.

	Other words beginning with D and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include dipper, dagger or dropper.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, could be either a ruler or a penguin?
questions.explanation:
emperor.

	Other words beginning with E and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include ether or examiner.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is a famous dolphin's name?
questions.explanation:
Flipper.

	Other words beginning with F and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include flapper or flatterer or firefighter.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, completes this familiar phrase? Win one for the _______.
questions.explanation:
Gipper.

	George Gipp was a young football star at Notre Dame in the early 1900s. He died at age 25, and his deathbed request was that future Notre Dame football players be asked to 'win one just for the Gipper', from time to time. The future Prez portrayed the Gipper in a movie.  Other words beginning with G and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include  glitter, grouper, or grounder.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, means impede?
questions.explanation:
hinder & hamper.

	Other words beginning with H and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include hitter or Mad Hatter or holster.

questions.text: T Which word, ending with the -ur sound, means to wound?
questions.explanation:
injure.

	Other words beginning with I and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include inner or interloper or interpreter.

questions.text: One of 12 decision makers in a courtroom could be described by which word, ending with the -ur sound?
questions.explanation:
juror.

	Another word beginning with J and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) is jabber.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is a type of Jewish folk music?
questions.explanation:
Klezmer & klezmir.

	Another word beginning with K and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) is kipper.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is a missive?
questions.explanation:
letter.

	Other words beginning with L and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include ladder, leader, litter, lighter, or lucre.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is Latin for 'mama'?
questions.explanation:
mater.

	Other words beginning with M and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include mother, mutter, mitre, muffler, or master.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is slang for 'small child'?
questions.explanation:
nipper.

	Anther word beginning with N and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) is nitpicker.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is a weasel's aquatic cousin?
questions.explanation:
otter.

	Anther word beginning with O and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) is onlooker.

questions.text: Harry _______: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is missing from this fictional character's name?
questions.explanation:
Potter.

	Other words beginning with P and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include pitter patter or peddlar or pater or pointer.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, might describe a drop-out or defeatist?
questions.explanation:
quitter.

	Other words beginning with Q and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include quarter or quizzer.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, describes a predatory bird such as a falcon?
questions.explanation:
raptor.

	Other words beginning with R and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include rattler or Riddler or Range Rover or Robyn Raymer.

questions.text: In the 60s and 70s, someone who got naked and raced across stages and through other public places was referred to by what word, ending with the -ur sound?
questions.explanation:
streaker.

	Other words beginning with S and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include sailor, settler, setter, or soldier.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, might be defined as a male seamstress?
questions.explanation:
tailor.

	Other words beginning with T and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include Tyler, Taylor, trailer, timber, timbre, tippler, trapper, or theater.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, describes where a calf's breakfast comes from?
questions.explanation:
udder.

	Anther word beginning with U and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) is utter.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is a kind of snake?
questions.explanation:
viper.

	Other words beginning with V and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include victor or vapor.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is slang for a big lie?
questions.explanation:
whopper.

	Other words beginning with W and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include whippersnapper or weather or whether or wether (a gelded male sheep).

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, might be used to describe a pleasure vessel sailor? (I'm skipping X, though XYSTER is in the Scrabble dictionary.)
questions.explanation:
yachter.

	Other words beginning with Y and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include yeasayer or yammer.

questions.text: Which word, ending with the -ur sound, is a kind of stringed instrument?
questions.explanation:
zither.

	Other six-letter words beginning with Z and ending with the "ur" sound (but not matching the clue) include zipper or zinger or zephyr (a gentle breeze and a monkey's name in the Babar books).
